website_summaries.verdict: If you need a LEGO Technic set for a kid who plays a little too rough with their toys, the speed, durability, and engine-tossing action of Bash is the perfect fit for them.
pros: Pull back and release to send Bash cruising
Designed to crash over and over
cons: At 6 inches long, Bash isn’t too large

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: What a fun little car. Unlike any other LEGO cat we’ve had. All other cars are delicate and you can’t really play with them but this thing is tough! It’s been dropped and smashed and it’s held together. It’s was a fun build for my 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Anders

customer_reviews.title: Great Set. Super Fun.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. Bought it for his 10th birthday. He’s been having so much fun with it. As you can he’s already lost the flames that come out the sides. He’s been running it over ramps and slamming it into walls and having a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build and play!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the corresponding "twin" for my nephews and they loved them! They are easy to put together for a 5 year old but challenging enough in the combined mode. They are also fun to play with once they are built because they have the pull-back to run engine and the fly-apart hood.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Siu

customer_reviews.title: Great buy small parts!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9 years old and he had a blast putting this together I do have to say if you have small children be careful the parts that come in this are very very tiny I do not have small children so it wasn't a problem for me. The packaging on the box is quiet flimsy and you cannot replace all the parts inside of it and expect it to keep them all there. For only paying 12 to $15 for this I thought it was a great by I've actually purchased a second one for my nephew because he seen my sons and was excited about it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to build
customer_reviews.text: My children enjoy these LEGO pull back cars. They work well. Children 8 and younger will need assistance to build. The directions are easy to understand, but if the little ones miss a step or aren’t good with visual directions, they may miss a block or use the wrong piece. Otherwise, it’s a pretty easy build. Definitely fun to play with. I enjoyed playing with the cars myself. I purchased 2 other styles of pull back cars. Great STEM project for primary grade kids.
customer_reviews.author: D DeCosta

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great gift for the creator in your life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my nine-year-old grandson. You can't go wrong with Legos, right? Give the model extra tricks and features, and it's sure to be a hit. I especially liked that it was a kit of some substance for a reasonable price, and this one can bear out lots and lots of use and reuse. With a lot of sets, they're tiny one-hit wonders (put it together and forget it); not really worth the jacked-up price. This one doesn't fall into that category, and, man! Does it look cool!
customer_reviews.author: Never At A Loss For Words

customer_reviews.title: Love the pull back feature!
customer_reviews.text: My 8yo boy LOVES this set. He was able to assemble the whole thing on his own but it was a good challenge for him. He loves the fact that it pulls back and that the engine pops off when it’s crashes. It’s quite durable once built and has stayed together through a lot of play. Perfect for his age!
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Buddies (deal- finding Facebook Group)

customer_reviews.title: Very cool lego car
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yr old put it together by himself Easter morning and loves it. It goes pretty far and fast, too.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - Good fun
customer_reviews.text: We gave this as a gift to a 6 year old. His dad had to help him assemble it (about 20 minutes) The instructions were easy to follow and he loved the action of the engine popping out when it ran into an object, he played with it for hours. The car itself held up extremely well as it was run into objects over and over again and never lost a piece off the car. Much better quality than expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frog

customer_reviews.title: My friend's 5 year old son loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend's son. She said he loved it. It said for six and up, but he's pretty smart. She said he had trouble with a few of the pieces and if you get so far, you have to take it apart and kind of start over. But, he wanted to do it himself, and he would take it apart and try again and finally this past week, he was able to do it by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Norie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for boys
customer_reviews.text: I got a bunch of these to give as gifts to all my nephews for Christmas this year. Got tired of them just watching tv or the phone. So I got them all these particular LEGO set so they can have more hands-on experience and the younger ones can assemble with their dads so they can all play together. The price made it so affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Working Mama

customer_reviews.title: Legos for the need for motion
customer_reviews.text: Bought on sale. Technic is for the 8+ crowd who need motion in their toys. Technic assembly is harder tho, so don’t be surprised if adult assist is needed. This product is sturdy, engaging, moves quite well. Recommend— buy it for kids 8-12ish who are drifting away from classic legos.
customer_reviews.author: Tickmoline

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your kid can do it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice said it was difficult for my seven-year-old son to put together. My son reads and as well above grade level and he had difficulty with the instructions. I recommend this if your child is in fourth grade or above. Overall it is a nice set but be careful with your kids age.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Orosco

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not lasting
customer_reviews.text: I gave this car as a gift to a child who loves legos and loved it. But after using it for 1 day there was a piece that fell off repeatedly which was very frustrating for him. He has insisted that I buy another but I really don't know if it's worth it. The price is good because it has quite a few pieces, it is beautiful and it moves fast.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: The quality
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, just that it did not arrive in good condition, makes it look like it is used.
customer_reviews.author: RICARDO BENITEZ

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5 year old son as a reward for school progress. This particular set was a little more challenging, for him, than similar LEGO sets. This one includes a lot of those snap in rod type pieces. He still enjoyed the process and only needed help a few times. He loves that he can crash it and watch the front piece fly off. I like that these specific pieces seem to stay together better than the LEGO block ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego car
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my seven-year-old grandsons for Christmas. They were a big hit! Fun for them to assemble, with a little help from mom, and lots of fun to play with. I’m impressed with the sturdiness of these cars: they don’t fall apart, even when knocked onto the floor from a table. And the fun factor of the pop-out engine is clever. Great toy for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: minted55

customer_reviews.title: Crash, Bam, rebuild
customer_reviews.text: The 2 grandsons LOVED getting these for their birthdays. They were perfect for 2 boys that tear everything up. These are made to crash and then rebuild. They were pretty hard to put together so we helped with that the first time, but after that they kids could rebuild them alone. They were a hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Fun Lego car with pull back and go action
customer_reviews.text: I paid about $15 and as far as Legos go I felt like this was a good value. The car is pretty neat, with the big rubber tires being one of the fun aspects. Also, having the pull back and go action in a lego car was really cool to me for some reason. Oh, and also, my son liked it. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Technic Bash! 42073
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my Great Grandson for his 7th Birthday. He had it together in no time. He's happy Double G's happy.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: GRANDSON LOVED IT!
customer_reviews.text: bought this one and one other (the green one) for my grandson, he is only 5 so I had to put it together, a little tricky....watch the age recommendation. one car had a better engine and went further than the other, but overall a very nice toy. the engine popping out as advertised on impact was a cool feature and he is able to put it back together easily at 5yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Theonlywolfe

customer_reviews.title: Adult supervision required due to small parts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my adult son who still likes legos as he shares the time with his sons. This item is one that I have not seen before so it was ordered for Christmas. I have photos that it was a hit with the boys. A good choice on my part.
customer_reviews.author: DGROBBY

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a young child!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for my 6 year old for Christmas. Him and my husband put it together by himself. He absolutely loves it. We also bought the Whack to go with it. He had so much fun with them. Best thing is I didn’t have to stress about crowds in the stores. I thought it was a good price point for the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita H.

customer_reviews.title: Autism friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Buying more! This is a great toy! My sons Are both autistic and absolutely love this toy! Pull it back and it really moves fast! Well made and great design doesn’t fall apart! Actually a lego toy built tough, this toy takes a beating and keeps working! Great job Lego!
customer_reviews.author: Thanks

customer_reviews.title: A Great Variation to a Lego Set
customer_reviews.text: I gave two of these cars to my grandson for his 7th birthday. His dad said that they were a challenge for an adult to assemble, so as long as a young child has help, it's a great car. My grandson loves these cars!
customer_reviews.author: Mamamia

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build, and fun afterwards...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a set (sold separately) for my nephew's birthday, and I like how not only does my nephew have fun building it, but once built, these cars are self propelled, so he can race them and have ongoing fun with them. The two cars that I bought are "Bash" and "Whack".
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo H

customer_reviews.title: Best 15 dollar lego value (pull back and release)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size/project for 15 dollars. Anytime you can get a friction/pull back motor included, its a win. Even after the toy has been disassembled and the parents have walked over 1/2 the pieces loose in the dark, you still have this mechanism for a different project. Score!
customer_reviews.author: D-DUB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my son and the box was damaged. When he took the first Lego out it was bent. Unfortunately couldn't return because I had purchased for Christmas so outside of the timeframe. So disappointed child...
customer_reviews.author: FAB

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a donation for...
customer_reviews.text: Lexi's Legos, a little girl at our church, to give to children who are taken to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta for tests, surgeries, treatments, etc. Legos get their mind off of what is being done to them and makes them happy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela W.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this car. Easy to build and fun to crash. He loves how the engine flies off on impact and it's simple to re-attach and crash again. We bought both cars to crash into each other - very entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Approved
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for grandsons to play with, ages 8 and 5. Parental assistance required for assembly but once they were together the boys absolutely loved them.
customer_reviews.author: bigfootTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Lego corporation sucks
customer_reviews.text: Will not buy any more Lego products since they made the political statement of removing police officer related figures and buildings from the store shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P. or Carol P.

customer_reviews.title: get at least two for the most fun
customer_reviews.text: this is a really fun, medium challenge build toy for children 7-12 years old. they are made to be assembled into even bigger toys with other LEGO technic BASH toys, so be sure to get at least 2 so you can build multiple versions from a single toy
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: is more of a challenge which is what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something that was more of a challenge for our grandson as he is able to put things together very quickly. This one has slowed him down and is more of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reash

customer_reviews.title: Harder to put together than regular legos
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old found them harder to put together even though he loves this car it was frustrating learning curve for sure. Probably better for a 8-9 year old
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nephew had fun !
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift my nephew loves race cars an building things so this was the best of both worlds for him He really liked it no complaints here !
customer_reviews.author: Tragedyeliotness

customer_reviews.title: Nice change to the basic lego set
customer_reviews.text: This set changes up a regular Lego set. Legos are over priced compared to competitive brands, but they are more innovative and will always be a hit with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Lego is always a favorite at our house. The technic sets are great for younger kids as they tend to be a little more durable, but are a little more challenging to build.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 5yo approved
customer_reviews.text: Fun build and kid digs it, but the engine/hood piece is poorly secured. Easily remedied with our own parts, but begs the question of why wasn't it designed that way in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For older kids or parent needed
customer_reviews.text: Tricky even for grownups to build. It doesn’t use too many standard LEGO pieces. It goes really fast! Kid loves playing with it, crashing it into things and putting it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Add2Cart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect build quality
customer_reviews.text: For a son obsessed with cars and Legos the technic series is the best combination you can ask for. My son lost his mind when he opened his set and got a good time put into the creation as well. The instructions were easy to follow and Gabe him a decent challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Harvey

customer_reviews.title: LEGO toys rock
customer_reviews.text: Who loved it more? Our grandson or our son (Daddy) who sat on the floor immediately to "help" him put it together! Great product, can't go wrong with LEGO.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma LOVES to climb trees

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for my LEGO crazy son. I A little harder to put together than traditional LEGO’s but still fun for him. He is 9
customer_reviews.author: B2brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego fit for a 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old grandson didn't have much difficulty assembling it but it did prove challenging enough to afford him the opportunity to appreciate it after it was assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2boys

customer_reviews.title: Technic set
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son loves Lego and absolutely loved this Technic set. He found it more challenging than the other Lego sets he has built and thoroughly enjoyed the build.
customer_reviews.author: FelixRez

customer_reviews.title: Super cool Lego car.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! Went together well and really goes the distance. Great racing car, we purchased another to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: R A Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fun set
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this. It was his first Lego set that had power. Very durable. He needed help building it, though, because he is not quite 6.
customer_reviews.author: jg grandma

customer_reviews.title: This was given as a gift and have never seen it in person so, I have no useful opinion on the item.
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a gift and have never seen it in person so, I have no useful opinion on the item.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyMe

customer_reviews.title: Happy Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson called and asked if I'd buy this for him. Which, of course I did. His mom says he plays withit all the time. It took him 15 minutes to put together by himself. He's 9.
customer_reviews.author: John Lusk

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces but can't beat the price for the value
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my brother as a gift. It was a bit difficult for 2nd grade to assemble, so I had to help. And there were a few pieces missing. But I couldn’t do anything, because I was out of country and it would be too late to return and get a replacement. Other than that I think it’s good for the price and my brother loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Cool!
customer_reviews.text: This little set is an absolute 5/5. Was easy to put together, looks absolutely cool! Price is good too! Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Darkmane

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, perfect for 10yo boy
customer_reviews.text: Gave my brother this for his birthday (he’s 10) and he loved it. Came on time and was as expected!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Gift Success
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for a young boy who loves building. This kit was great because not only can you build it, but it’s also mobile!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Kissel

customer_reviews.title: Made grandson very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson was happy! Well made! Makes a great gift! Popular with the kids!

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego gift.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product for a brother to give his little brother for Christmas. Purchased and selected it himself.
customer_reviews.author: Whenpigsflyaway

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a good set of instructions and the bash functionality works very well.

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this toy and has not stop playing with it since Christmas morning. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: diane lopez

customer_reviews.title: One of the LEGO best!
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves it so much! He still plays with it after more than a year. I would buy Lego anytime of the day with no hesitation. They make the best toys. Thank you LEGO!

customer_reviews.title: Lego
customer_reviews.text: Made a wonderful birthday gift for an 11 year old boy

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego Technic, that after assemle it you may play with the car
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting and challenging Lego technic for 6 years old boy. After assemble the car you can play with it like a regular car, and it's great. My son loves it very much.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!!!

customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old got these as his very first lego kit. He had a little help but built them mostly on his own. He loves playing with them too!

customer_reviews.title: Legos are always a great gift option

customer_reviews.title: 👍

product_meta.title: LEGO Technic BASH! 42073 Building Kit (139 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Experience the amazing power and acceleration of this rugged, high-speed LEGO Technic 42073 BASH! race car model, featuring a red, black and gray color scheme with racing stickers, sturdy front bumper, large rear spoiler and wide black rims with low profile tires. This advanced building set is equipped with a pull-back motor, and an engine pop-out function, which is activated on impact. Combine with the 42072 WHACK! pull-back model for extended play possibilities or to create the WHACK! ‘N’ BASH! combo model.
feature_bullets: Build a fast car with a powerful pull-back motor, sturdy front bumper, large rear spoiler, wide black rims with low profile tires and an engine that pops out on impact
Measures over 2-inch (7cm) high, 6-inch (17cm) long and 3-inch (9cm) wide Combi model measures over 3-inch (9cm) high, 7-inch (20cm) long and 3-inch (10cm) wide
139 pieces – For boys and girls between the ages of 7 and 14
LEGO Technic building sets are compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building
Combine this crash car toy with the LEGO Technic 42072 WHACK! to create an awesome WHACK! ‘N’ BASH! combo model with two pop out engines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,134 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
